course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Maternal & Child Nutrition
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 19 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: Nutritional status before, during and after conception can impact not only a person's health in the short and long term, but also that of the child. Similarly, early life malnutrition can have lifelong consequences. As such, maternal and child malnutrition remains a leading risk factor for disability-adjusted life years. This course will explore the biological basis for unique nutritional requirements during the perinatal period and in childhood, and will use a lifecourse perspective to examine inter-generational effects of over- and under-nutrition. We will also discuss evidence-based approaches to improve maternal and child nutrition in low-, middle-, and high-income countries. (prerequisite: HLTH 220)
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
schedule_location: MW 1pm-2:15pm in Emerson Chemistry Bldg. E363
